intro: Clarisia panamensis, commonly known as the Panama clarisia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
